page.title: 17Milk and Beef Production
page.content: E.E.C. Regulations limiting the milk quota has led to some diversification and more farms are now mainly arable with some beef and sheep. The two main dairy herds are at Nevill Holt and Drayton. Modern electric milking parlours mean that the milk is collected quickly and cleanly. Beef cattle are bought in for fattening on the rich pastures during the summer.Sheep are bred mainly for the lamb trade although the wool is sold to firms at Market Harborough. Examples of market prices - Steers:light 92.0p.,medium to 101.0p.,heavy to 107.0p. Lambs; light to 138.5p//kg. standard to 160.0p/kg.heavy to 144.3p/kg. There are some smallholdings running some cattle, sheep, goats, and pigs plus producing free range eggs. .
